results.title: Ancient Tashkent: an impression
results.brief_description: For a relatively short time Tashkent was a great market city on the spice route from China to Europe. This lyrical non-narrative film draws in viewers to experience for themselves the richness of its mosaics and the grandeur of its architecture. Makes imaginitive use of authentic Uzbek music.

results.title: Safety in the Kitchen
results.brief_description: Danger areas and high accident risk situations in the kitchen are examined and safe working procedures suggested. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Vegetables for all seasons
results.brief_description: Follows vegetables from the farm to the market to the kitchen, and explains some basic techniques for buying and preparing vegetables.

results.title: Eclair. Episode 05
results.creator_credit: Alma Gray, David Ash, Pat McLagan and ILEA
results.brief_description: The series “Eclair” features Ted, a rather confused and naive Englishman and a pair of mischievous French adolescent twins. The theme of this film is: “Sport and recreation” and an introduction to the immediate future where the verb ‘after’ is used with the infinitive.

results.title: Eclair. Episode 01
results.creator_credit: Alma Gray, David Ash, Pat McLagan and ILEA
results.brief_description: The series “Eclair” features Ted, a rather confused and naive Englishman and a pair of mischievous French adolescent twins. The theme of this film is: “Finding your way - Arrival in a French town, Dieppe” using simple language, and understanding directions given orally.

results.title: Sam Smith: Genuine England
results.creator_credit: Shaw Ashton, Andrew Lee and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: An insight into the life and work of Sam Smith, doll-maker extraordinaire. He relates snippets from his life as he discusses the making of his unusual dolls.

results.title: The Long distance search for the great Australian funny bone. - Edited version
results.brief_description: A variety of yarns and tall stories are told in this edited version of the search for the key to Australian humour. Includes animated sequences. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
